headline: Banana Muffins
description: These banana muffins are deliciously moist and tender. Made with ripe mashed bananas and simple pantry ingredients ‚Äî they are easy for kids to make!

video.description: See how to make simple but delicious banana muffins.
video.name: Banana Muffins II

name: Banana Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners. Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl; set aside.
Mix bananas, sugar, egg, and melted butter in a separate large bowl until well combined; fold in flour mixture until smooth. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 25 to 30 minutes. Cool briefly in the tin, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: This recipe should have two eggs, not one.
Super easy and super good. Made as is.
It was a good stater recipe. It was missing cinnamon and vanilla. I also used a little brown sugar.
I would love to have a recipe that makes more than just a dozen
Very easy, doubled recipe, made 30 muffins. Also added walnuts.
Super soft and so delicious. I added choco chips and some roasted chopped walnuts. I baked for 23 min and made 12. Thanks for sharing such a perfect recipe.

Second best banana muffins (only to my moms). I used bananas that I had frozen, so there was an excess of liquid. That was an easy fix, though, with about a cup of oatmeal in a double batch. I found out that this is a very forgiving recipe. These are going to be great with butter, and a cup of coffee, for breakfast tomorrow!
Easy! No special ingredients, had everything I needed right here!!
Made mini muffins, delicious! Cooked them for 14 minutes, I got about 40 out of the batch, 2 left‚Ä¶in about 24 hours.
I found the recipe too dry. I added extra butter and a banana but it wasn‚Äôt as good as other recipes on here
Easy, fast, delicious!

This is a very good recipe. The muffins were super moist and not too sweet. I did cut back on the sugar by a 1/4 of a cup. I also added walnuts. Next time I'll use pecans. I think the secret to keep the muffins moist is to use very ripe bananas.

This is honestly my favourite recipe to make, its quick and simple, I use butter to grease my tins to ensure it pops out easily, and it ends up with a nice crust when freshly baked, and it's even better the next day
I use 1/4 cup less sugar and they were plenty sweet.
Amazing recipe!! I've made it so many times for friends. If you can't do butter then use olive oil. I also add a hint of maple syrup to mine

so good! i made them on a whim because i wanted to bake. I used Overripe bananas because i didn‚Äôt think I would use them for anything else and it turned out so well! Light and fluffy and didn‚Äôt fall apart as I took them out of the pan!

I liked it but there isn't enough liquid. I added a bit of milk and cinnamon. With the 3 very ripe bananas and the natural sugars I cut the white sugar to 1/2 cup. I only needed to cook them for about 18 minutes at 350.

So fluffy and moist!! I did mini muffins and cut the baking time to 12 minutes. I did cut back the sugar to 1/3 cup, and added vanilla. I also use overripe bananas that I have frozen (they are so much sweeter and have more moisture once thawed) but instead of using three bananas I use 4 so there is enough volume.
I love this recipe. I add about 1/4 cup of sour cream, which I believe adds to the fluffiness. I also cut the amount of sugar down to about 1/4 cup, and finally, I add a dollop of vanilla. Delicious!
We made mini muffins, they were so moist and tasty. They were DELICIOUS. We will definitely make them again.
These turned out great!! Followed the recipe exactly and my family loved them!

Very yummy not dry! Moist I made mini muffins 36 to 1 recipe i did add some with mini chocolate chips the other with vanilla, and some plain. My husband just said to me, DO WE HAVE MORE???? It's a keeper!
I absolutely loved these muffins they tasted amazing. I tripled the recipe expecting to only make eighteen but instead I made thirty. But my three kids and husband ate them right up in no time.
Very moist and tasty

I made this recipe with 1:1 glutten free flour!! It worked perfectly. I got a Ninja speedi airfryer for Christmas and wanted to try baking in it...I used this recipe and made 2 batches of 4 each very large muffins. I used the steam and bake function at 350¬∞ for 9 min. It steams for the first 15 to 20 min and then the convection finishes it. Perfection!!!!!
delicious! and essay
Very tasty and easy. I didnt have enough banana so I added a small single serving of unsweetened applesauce. Added pecans and walnuts. Baked for 20 minutes, muffins were perfect.
Super moist.
My family loves this recipe! It is easy to make and we all love how moist and flavorful the muffins are. I add an extra banana and a teaspoon of vanilla extract. It always comes out great!
So quick and easy to make. I used 4 bananas and added in dried cranberries and got 14 large muffins. So delicious.
Added 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips and 1 tsp. vanilla. So good!

Followed the recipe exactly, probably over mixed the batter a bit, but they turned out great! Will add another banana next time & some vanilla just to see what happens, but solidly good recipe without any tweaks!
Good base recipe but better when sub 2 tsp baking powder, add dash cinnamon, 1/2 tsp vanilla and cut sugar to 1/2 cup. I add chocolate chips and ground flax too

Great flavor. Moist. Easy recipe. I used bananas I had frozen, added mini chocolate chips (my kids love this touch) and made them into mini muffins, instead of the larger muffins. I would have added a pic, but they are gone already!
Came our perfect üëçüèª

Followed the recipe exactly. The muffins didn't rise and easily fell apart when I took them out of the muffin pan. The flavor was good (what can be bad about banana flavor? ) but the texture was far too light for a muffin.

Soooooo perfectly üòã!!! Delicious!!! My husband couldn't stop saying, wow! Nina, these are gourmet muffins! And of course I'm like, right?! Whilst my mouth is full of delicious banana muffins.... best ever!!! REALLY!!! ‚ô•

oh my word, oh my oh my :-) just made these this morning - using Shelly Bourbonnais's additions and recommendation for 4 bananas, choc chips and i used a teaspoon of vanilla extract. this is without question one of the tastiest and easiest banana muffin/cake recipes i've ever used. will make again and wholeheartedly recommend. absolutely delicious.
Absolutely yummy!

These are my go to muffins and I have been making this recipe for years. They are easy, moist and delicious! The only change I have made (which is based on my person preference) is I add an extra banana (so 4 bananas), a handful of chocolate chips and a bit of vanilla extract. I also always use a wooden spoon when making muffins so that they never get over mixed. I love to eat one when they have only been out of the oven for 10 minutes or so and are still warm!
Very easy to make and taste great!
Simple recipe great muffins
used coconut oil instead of butter and added melted chocolate on top but they came out amazing. also added granola, cinnamon, and honey
Yummmy ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è
Very moist and super easy! Love this recipes.
Moist and delicious!
The muffins turned out really well! I used avocado oils
These were great!!!

Yummy for such an easy recipe! I made These for my two little girls. I used 1/2 whole wheat flour, 1/2 white flour, decreased the amount of sugar and added some oats! I also added a large handful of chocolate chips. Next time I think I may try out less butter, but add applesauce. My girls LOVED these!!! I will make them again and again.

My daughter sent me this recipe, it is so good üëç. My husband buys extra bananas so we all ways have ripe ones. Made no changes yet. But our apple tree is just loaded this year, so I will be trying to add apples and see how it goes. Thanks for a great recipe.
Delicious! I took the advice of another reviewer and added cinnamon and vanilla extract. I also added chocolate chips (about half a bag.) Easy and yummy!
I added chocolate chips.
It was good we added chocolate chips and pecans on top.
Easy and delicious. I wish I would've added chia seeds or flax to give it a healthier touch.

Easy to follow recipe although I did alter a few things. I reduced the sugar to 1/2 a cup as for me bananas are sweet enough. I also substitute 1/4 c no fat pain Greek yogurt for the egg and instead of butter used safflower oil. Less trans fat still great taste!
Good Muffins. You can do all kinds of things with this one. I subbed applesauce for the fat. Next time i'll add mango or blueberries.
I cut back on the sugar just a little and added ¬Ω c chocolate chips. These were excellent, moist and fluffy.
I add on chocolate chunks and lessen the sugar. Simple and great to make with my boys aged 8 & 6
Easy recipe. My grandson loves to make and eat them!
Will save you some time. Add cooking oil 1/2 cup instead of butter Put some chocolate chips on top Bake 375F for 25 mins. It‚Äôll come out so nice

Best Banana muffins I've ever made! I followed the ingredient list & directions to a tee and they turned out perfectly. I added my own streusel on top the second time around and they were even better!
10/10 absolutely love my 2 year old just devoured them for snacks last time so had to make even more
Nice recipe, came out nice,used 1/4 cup olive oil instead of butter and it came out nice
made per the recipe, delicious.

Have not made them yet, but sound great. Can you sub greek yogurt for butter for lower fat/higher protein? Edit: made per instructions, used 1:1 swap non fat vanilla Greek yogurt for the butter, added 1 tsp each of vanilla and cinnamon. Turned out really great
I‚Äôm making them right now

I've made this twice now in the last 2 weeks. I added an extra banana the first time I made it because I had 4 I needed to use up. Turned out great, so I just put 4 bananas in now. My family tore them up! Thanks for sharing this simple yet scrumptious recipe!

I make these muffins often, and usually sub in half of the white sugar with brown and add vanilla and chocolate chips. Also can be made into a one-bowl recipe by melting butter in a large bowl first and then adding the first set of ingredients, and then sifting the dry ingredient directly into the same bowl.
Awesome, added sprinkle of brown sugar and walnuts on top

My daughter said that these were the best ever! She‚Äôs 25 and a picky eater. Changes made: Added vanilla extract (measure with your heart üíú) Added cinnamon to the batter (1tsp maybe) I melted the remaining bits of butter from the stick. When they came out of the oven I brushed the tops with butter and sprinkled Cinnamon Toast Crunch cinnadust on top (basically just cinnamon and sugar mixed)
These came out perfect! Great recipe!
So simple and easy..just made it aug.2,2022..I put 4 bananas and 1/2 cup grated carrots
Adorable and Delicious!!!! Made exactly per recipe in mini muffin pan.
This is a lovely banana muffin - moist with wonderful banana flavor. I will use a scant measure of baking soda next time as I thought it was a bit noticeable. Overall, an excellent recipe!
Love this recipe. Doubt I‚Äôll ever use a different one. I use it for muffins and loafs alike. Great with walnuts and/or chocolate chips
It was delicious!Thank you for sharing the receipe! I put a banana slice on the top of the muffines :)
I had to double the recipe but melted ¬æcups of butter instead of ‚Öî but it should still taste good üëç üòã
Delicious muffins. My kids loved them! I did use whole wheat flour instead of white flour and added chocolate chips.
I made these today, they were quite tasty! I added cinnamon and nutmeg. Without the added spices I fear they‚Äôd be bland.
The recipe was amazing. I may have dded a bii more banana. I highly recommend.
I loved it üòç

Delicious and easy! My bananas were frozen and I read on another receipt that if you peel the frozen banana and put them in a strainer with a bowl underneath, the banana will produce a juice. In one batch, I wanted to put walnuts, so I used 3/4 of the juice from the bananas, so it wasn't dry. I also put the reminder of the juice in the other batch because my family likes them moist. Both batches came out great.
This is a great recipe! I added a half teaspoon of almond extract and 1 cup of walnuts. Love it with a cup of coffee. Glenn
Simple, old fashioned recipe. I used walnuts in mine. And just a few also had Chocolate chips.
Just added some cinnamon & pecan bits, they‚Äôre AMAZING !!!
Love this. Added cocoa, walnuts, and used extra virgin olive oil. Just perfect!
My family loved the muffins. The pic we added a tablespoon of mix to cover the added fruit and chocolate chips. Today we are making for the 2nd time.

I made these adding a teaspoon of vanilla and cinnamon and they were delicious! I also substituted the butter for unsweetened applesauce, and added mini semisweet chocolate chips. I cooked the muffins a little shorter than it stated on the recipe and they turned out great! I will definitely make these again!
I doubled the recipe and I added chopped walnuts to it it was wonderful

I made the muffins are they were the best I‚Äôve ever had, super moist. I went back to copy the recipe afterwards and realized I completely forgot to add any butter. The recipe was fantastic without any. Also, I didn‚Äôt have any vanilla extract left so I replaced it with coconut extract.
It was easy to make and i added 1 cup of pecans and one cup white chocolate chips.... Delicious!
These are amazing! I added a little vanilla and buttered the tops when they came out of the oven. I will certainly be making these again soon!
They were moist and delicious
These are amazing. I did add oil instead of butter. Put 1 tsp of vanilla and added chocolate chips and raisins
Muffins turned out great. Still moist even after slightly over baking them. Will make again for sure
I substituted egg for ‚Äújust egg‚Äù and used plant-based butter to make the recipe vegan. Turned out pretty good!
They taste amazing. I added some vanilla cinnamon and a sprinkle of nutmeg they are sooo good
They were really moist. I also added oatmeal and vanilla,that was also good. I liked this recipe and would definitely recommend trying it.

Since I am fond of using brown sugar/cinnamon in many of my baked goods, I added a pinch of cinnamon and used half white, half brown sugar. I am sure the original would have been tasty as well! They were quick and easy to make, smelled heavenly, looked beautiful and tasted wonderful!
